title: Programming in Base R
text:
Suppose we have data from a medical experiment on blood pressure. We want to determine that change in blood pressure before and after treatment.
Assign objects pre-measurements and post-measurements

pre_bp <- c(120, 151, 125, 126, 115, 132, 132, 129, 134, 139, 127, 122, 127, 135, 133, 128, 147, 138, 140, 132)
pre_bp

 [1] 120 151 125 126 115 132 132 129 134 139 127 122 127 135 133 128 147 138 140
[20] 132

post_bp <- c(127, 145, 135, 122, 115, 122, 123, 126, 126, 129, 132, 146, 120, 114, 121, 120, 128, 120, 133, 115)
post_bp

 [1] 127 145 135 122 115 122 123 126 126 129 132 146 120 114 121 120 128 120 133
[20] 115


Assign names to the vector elements using paste() function

patient <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")
patient

 [1] "Subject_1"  "Subject_2"  "Subject_3"  "Subject_4"  "Subject_5" 
 [6] "Subject_6"  "Subject_7"  "Subject_8"  "Subject_9"  "Subject_10"
[11] "Subject_11" "Subject_12" "Subject_13" "Subject_14" "Subject_15"
[16] "Subject_16" "Subject_17" "Subject_18" "Subject_19" "Subject_20"


Create the same names for each vectors elements using the names() function

names(pre_bp) <- patient
names(post_bp) <- patient

Calculate the change in blood pressure for each patient by subtracting post-treatment measurements from pre-treatment measurements. Create a Vector for this object.

diff_bp <- c(pre_bp - post_bp)
diff_bp

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
        -7          6        -10          4          0         10          9 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 Subject_11 Subject_12 Subject_13 Subject_14 
         3          8         10         -5        -24          7         21 
Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
        12          8         19         18          7         17 


Calculate the average decrease in blood pressure across all patients using mean() function

mean(diff_bp)

[1] 5.65


Determine which patients experienced a decrease in blood pressure after treatment using which() function Return the indices and names associated with this type of change

which(diff_bp > 0)

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
         2          4          6          7          8          9         10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
        13         14         15         16         17         18         19 
Subject_20 
        20 


Subset the vector of differences to return those that have a positive change

decreased_bp <- diff_bp[diff_bp > 0]
decreased_bp

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
         6          4         10          9          3          8         10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
         7         21         12          8         19         18          7 
Subject_20 
        17 


Calculate the average decrease in blood pressure for those where the blood pressure decreased

mean(decreased_bp)

[1] 10.6





Create a data frame with four columns corresponding to the data above

bp_df <- data.frame(patient,pre_bp,post_bp,diff_bp, row.names = NULL)
bp_df

      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp
1   Subject_1    120     127      -7
2   Subject_2    151     145       6
3   Subject_3    125     135     -10
4   Subject_4    126     122       4
5   Subject_5    115     115       0
6   Subject_6    132     122      10
7   Subject_7    132     123       9
8   Subject_8    129     126       3
9   Subject_9    134     126       8
10 Subject_10    139     129      10
11 Subject_11    127     132      -5
12 Subject_12    122     146     -24
13 Subject_13    127     120       7
14 Subject_14    135     114      21
15 Subject_15    133     121      12
16 Subject_16    128     120       8
17 Subject_17    147     128      19
18 Subject_18    138     120      18
19 Subject_19    140     133       7
20 Subject_20    132     115      17


Return only rows of the data frame where the diff bp columns is negative

subset(bp_df, (diff_bp < 0))

      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp
1   Subject_1    120     127      -7
3   Subject_3    125     135     -10
11 Subject_11    127     132      -5
12 Subject_12    122     146     -24


Determine which patients experienced a decrease in blood pressure after treatment using which() function Return the indices and names associated with this type of change

which(diff_bp > 0)

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
         2          4          6          7          8          9         10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
        13         14         15         16         17         18         19 
Subject_20 
        20 


Add a new column to the data frame corresponding to TRUE if the post_bp is less than 120 and FALSE if it is not

bp_df$bp_under_120 <- bp_df$post_bp < 120
bp_df

      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp bp_under_120
1   Subject_1    120     127      -7        FALSE
2   Subject_2    151     145       6        FALSE
3   Subject_3    125     135     -10        FALSE
4   Subject_4    126     122       4        FALSE
5   Subject_5    115     115       0         TRUE
6   Subject_6    132     122      10        FALSE
7   Subject_7    132     123       9        FALSE
8   Subject_8    129     126       3        FALSE
9   Subject_9    134     126       8        FALSE
10 Subject_10    139     129      10        FALSE
11 Subject_11    127     132      -5        FALSE
12 Subject_12    122     146     -24        FALSE
13 Subject_13    127     120       7        FALSE
14 Subject_14    135     114      21         TRUE
15 Subject_15    133     121      12        FALSE
16 Subject_16    128     120       8        FALSE
17 Subject_17    147     128      19        FALSE
18 Subject_18    138     120      18        FALSE
19 Subject_19    140     133       7        FALSE
20 Subject_20    132     115      17         TRUE


Print the data frame out nicely in final document

knitr::kable(bp_df)




patient
pre_bp
post_bp
diff_bp
bp_under_120




Subject_1
120
127
-7
FALSE


Subject_2
151
145
6
FALSE


Subject_3
125
135
-10
FALSE


Subject_4
126
122
4
FALSE


Subject_5
115
115
0
TRUE


Subject_6
132
122
10
FALSE


Subject_7
132
123
9
FALSE


Subject_8
129
126
3
FALSE


Subject_9
134
126
8
FALSE


Subject_10
139
129
10
FALSE


Subject_11
127
132
-5
FALSE


Subject_12
122
146
-24
FALSE


Subject_13
127
120
7
FALSE


Subject_14
135
114
21
TRUE


Subject_15
133
121
12
FALSE


Subject_16
128
120
8
FALSE


Subject_17
147
128
19
FALSE


Subject_18
138
120
18
FALSE


Subject_19
140
133
7
FALSE


Subject_20
132
115
17
TRUE








Create vectors for before and after placebo

placebo_pre_bp <- c(138, 135, 147, 117, 152, 134, 114, 121, 131, 130)
placebo_pre_bp

 [1] 138 135 147 117 152 134 114 121 131 130

placebo_post_bp <- c(105, 136, 123, 130, 134, 143, 135, 139, 120, 124)
placebo_post_bp

 [1] 105 136 123 130 134 143 135 139 120 124


Assign names to the vector elements using paste() function

placebo_patient <- paste("Subject", 1:10, sep = "_")
placebo_patient

 [1] "Subject_1"  "Subject_2"  "Subject_3"  "Subject_4"  "Subject_5" 
 [6] "Subject_6"  "Subject_7"  "Subject_8"  "Subject_9"  "Subject_10"


Create the same names for each vectors elements using the names() function

names(placebo_pre_bp) <- placebo_patient
names(placebo_post_bp) <- placebo_patient

Calculate the change in blood pressure for each patient by subtracting post-placebo measurements from pre-placebo measurements. Create a Vector for this object.

placebo_diff_bp <- c(placebo_pre_bp - placebo_post_bp)
placebo_diff_bp

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
        33         -1         24        -13         18         -9        -21 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
       -18         11          6 


Create a vector corresponding to TRUE if the placebo_post_bp is less than 120 and FALSE if it is not

placebo_bp_under_120 <- placebo_post_bp < 120
placebo_bp_under_120

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
      TRUE      FALSE      FALSE      FALSE      FALSE      FALSE      FALSE 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
     FALSE      FALSE      FALSE 


Create a new data frame with this data in it that is similar to the data frame from task two (including the new column of TRUE/FALSE)

placebo_bp_df <- data.frame(placebo_patient,placebo_pre_bp,placebo_post_bp,placebo_diff_bp,placebo_bp_under_120, row.names = NULL)
placebo_bp_df

   placebo_patient placebo_pre_bp placebo_post_bp placebo_diff_bp
1        Subject_1            138             105              33
2        Subject_2            135             136              -1
3        Subject_3            147             123              24
4        Subject_4            117             130             -13
5        Subject_5            152             134              18
6        Subject_6            134             143              -9
7        Subject_7            114             135             -21
8        Subject_8            121             139             -18
9        Subject_9            131             120              11
10      Subject_10            130             124               6
   placebo_bp_under_120
1                  TRUE
2                 FALSE
3                 FALSE
4                 FALSE
5                 FALSE
6                 FALSE
7                 FALSE
8                 FALSE
9                 FALSE
10                FALSE


Now create and store a list with two elements: • 1st element named treatment and contains the first data frame you created. • 2nd element named placebo and contains the second data frame you created.

list_bp <- list(treatment = bp_df, placebo = placebo_bp_df)
list_bp

$treatment
      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp bp_under_120
1   Subject_1    120     127      -7        FALSE
2   Subject_2    151     145       6        FALSE
3   Subject_3    125     135     -10        FALSE
4   Subject_4    126     122       4        FALSE
5   Subject_5    115     115       0         TRUE
6   Subject_6    132     122      10        FALSE
7   Subject_7    132     123       9        FALSE
8   Subject_8    129     126       3        FALSE
9   Subject_9    134     126       8        FALSE
10 Subject_10    139     129      10        FALSE
11 Subject_11    127     132      -5        FALSE
12 Subject_12    122     146     -24        FALSE
13 Subject_13    127     120       7        FALSE
14 Subject_14    135     114      21         TRUE
15 Subject_15    133     121      12        FALSE
16 Subject_16    128     120       8        FALSE
17 Subject_17    147     128      19        FALSE
18 Subject_18    138     120      18        FALSE
19 Subject_19    140     133       7        FALSE
20 Subject_20    132     115      17         TRUE

$placebo
   placebo_patient placebo_pre_bp placebo_post_bp placebo_diff_bp
1        Subject_1            138             105              33
2        Subject_2            135             136              -1
3        Subject_3            147             123              24
4        Subject_4            117             130             -13
5        Subject_5            152             134              18
6        Subject_6            134             143              -9
7        Subject_7            114             135             -21
8        Subject_8            121             139             -18
9        Subject_9            131             120              11
10      Subject_10            130             124               6
   placebo_bp_under_120
1                  TRUE
2                 FALSE
3                 FALSE
4                 FALSE
5                 FALSE
6                 FALSE
7                 FALSE
8                 FALSE
9                 FALSE
10                FALSE


Access the first list element using three different types of syntax (the result can be a list or just the data frame).

list_bp["treatment"]

$treatment
      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp bp_under_120
1   Subject_1    120     127      -7        FALSE
2   Subject_2    151     145       6        FALSE
3   Subject_3    125     135     -10        FALSE
4   Subject_4    126     122       4        FALSE
5   Subject_5    115     115       0         TRUE
6   Subject_6    132     122      10        FALSE
7   Subject_7    132     123       9        FALSE
8   Subject_8    129     126       3        FALSE
9   Subject_9    134     126       8        FALSE
10 Subject_10    139     129      10        FALSE
11 Subject_11    127     132      -5        FALSE
12 Subject_12    122     146     -24        FALSE
13 Subject_13    127     120       7        FALSE
14 Subject_14    135     114      21         TRUE
15 Subject_15    133     121      12        FALSE
16 Subject_16    128     120       8        FALSE
17 Subject_17    147     128      19        FALSE
18 Subject_18    138     120      18        FALSE
19 Subject_19    140     133       7        FALSE
20 Subject_20    132     115      17         TRUE

list_bp[["treatment"]]

      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp bp_under_120
1   Subject_1    120     127      -7        FALSE
2   Subject_2    151     145       6        FALSE
3   Subject_3    125     135     -10        FALSE
4   Subject_4    126     122       4        FALSE
5   Subject_5    115     115       0         TRUE
6   Subject_6    132     122      10        FALSE
7   Subject_7    132     123       9        FALSE
8   Subject_8    129     126       3        FALSE
9   Subject_9    134     126       8        FALSE
10 Subject_10    139     129      10        FALSE
11 Subject_11    127     132      -5        FALSE
12 Subject_12    122     146     -24        FALSE
13 Subject_13    127     120       7        FALSE
14 Subject_14    135     114      21         TRUE
15 Subject_15    133     121      12        FALSE
16 Subject_16    128     120       8        FALSE
17 Subject_17    147     128      19        FALSE
18 Subject_18    138     120      18        FALSE
19 Subject_19    140     133       7        FALSE
20 Subject_20    132     115      17         TRUE

list_bp$treatment

      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp bp_under_120
1   Subject_1    120     127      -7        FALSE
2   Subject_2    151     145       6        FALSE
3   Subject_3    125     135     -10        FALSE
4   Subject_4    126     122       4        FALSE
5   Subject_5    115     115       0         TRUE
6   Subject_6    132     122      10        FALSE
7   Subject_7    132     123       9        FALSE
8   Subject_8    129     126       3        FALSE
9   Subject_9    134     126       8        FALSE
10 Subject_10    139     129      10        FALSE
11 Subject_11    127     132      -5        FALSE
12 Subject_12    122     146     -24        FALSE
13 Subject_13    127     120       7        FALSE
14 Subject_14    135     114      21         TRUE
15 Subject_15    133     121      12        FALSE
16 Subject_16    128     120       8        FALSE
17 Subject_17    147     128      19        FALSE
18 Subject_18    138     120      18        FALSE
19 Subject_19    140     133       7        FALSE
20 Subject_20    132     115      17         TRUE


In one line of code, access the pre_bp column of the placebo data frame

list_bp$placebo$placebo_pre_bp

 [1] 138 135 147 117 152 134 114 121 131 130

title: Programming in Base R
text:
Suppose we have data from a medical experiment on blood pressure. We want to determine that change in blood pressure before and after treatment.
Assign objects pre-measurements and post-measurements

pre_bp <- c(120, 151, 125, 126, 115, 132, 132, 129, 134, 139, 127, 122, 127, 135, 133, 128, 147, 138, 140, 132)
pre_bp

 [1] 120 151 125 126 115 132 132 129 134 139 127 122 127 135 133 128 147 138 140
[20] 132

post_bp <- c(127, 145, 135, 122, 115, 122, 123, 126, 126, 129, 132, 146, 120, 114, 121, 120, 128, 120, 133, 115)
post_bp

 [1] 127 145 135 122 115 122 123 126 126 129 132 146 120 114 121 120 128 120 133
[20] 115


Assign names to the vector elements using paste() function

patient <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")
patient

 [1] "Subject_1"  "Subject_2"  "Subject_3"  "Subject_4"  "Subject_5" 
 [6] "Subject_6"  "Subject_7"  "Subject_8"  "Subject_9"  "Subject_10"
[11] "Subject_11" "Subject_12" "Subject_13" "Subject_14" "Subject_15"
[16] "Subject_16" "Subject_17" "Subject_18" "Subject_19" "Subject_20"


Create the same names for each vectors elements using the names() function

names(pre_bp) <- patient
names(post_bp) <- patient

Calculate the change in blood pressure for each patient by subtracting post-treatment measurements from pre-treatment measurements. Create a Vector for this object.

diff_bp <- c(pre_bp - post_bp)
diff_bp

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
        -7          6        -10          4          0         10          9 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 Subject_11 Subject_12 Subject_13 Subject_14 
         3          8         10         -5        -24          7         21 
Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
        12          8         19         18          7         17 


Calculate the average decrease in blood pressure across all patients using mean() function

mean(diff_bp)

[1] 5.65


Determine which patients experienced a decrease in blood pressure after treatment using which() function Return the indices and names associated with this type of change

which(diff_bp > 0)

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
         2          4          6          7          8          9         10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
        13         14         15         16         17         18         19 
Subject_20 
        20 


Subset the vector of differences to return those that have a positive change

decreased_bp <- diff_bp[diff_bp > 0]
decreased_bp

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
         6          4         10          9          3          8         10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
         7         21         12          8         19         18          7 
Subject_20 
        17 


Calculate the average decrease in blood pressure for those where the blood pressure decreased

mean(decreased_bp)

[1] 10.6

title: Programming in Base R
text:
Create a data frame with four columns corresponding to the data above

bp_df <- data.frame(patient,pre_bp,post_bp,diff_bp, row.names = NULL)
bp_df

      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp
1   Subject_1    120     127      -7
2   Subject_2    151     145       6
3   Subject_3    125     135     -10
4   Subject_4    126     122       4
5   Subject_5    115     115       0
6   Subject_6    132     122      10
7   Subject_7    132     123       9
8   Subject_8    129     126       3
9   Subject_9    134     126       8
10 Subject_10    139     129      10
11 Subject_11    127     132      -5
12 Subject_12    122     146     -24
13 Subject_13    127     120       7
14 Subject_14    135     114      21
15 Subject_15    133     121      12
16 Subject_16    128     120       8
17 Subject_17    147     128      19
18 Subject_18    138     120      18
19 Subject_19    140     133       7
20 Subject_20    132     115      17


Return only rows of the data frame where the diff bp columns is negative

subset(bp_df, (diff_bp < 0))

      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp
1   Subject_1    120     127      -7
3   Subject_3    125     135     -10
11 Subject_11    127     132      -5
12 Subject_12    122     146     -24


Determine which patients experienced a decrease in blood pressure after treatment using which() function Return the indices and names associated with this type of change

which(diff_bp > 0)

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
         2          4          6          7          8          9         10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
        13         14         15         16         17         18         19 
Subject_20 
        20 


Add a new column to the data frame corresponding to TRUE if the post_bp is less than 120 and FALSE if it is not

bp_df$bp_under_120 <- bp_df$post_bp < 120
bp_df

      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp bp_under_120
1   Subject_1    120     127      -7        FALSE
2   Subject_2    151     145       6        FALSE
3   Subject_3    125     135     -10        FALSE
4   Subject_4    126     122       4        FALSE
5   Subject_5    115     115       0         TRUE
6   Subject_6    132     122      10        FALSE
7   Subject_7    132     123       9        FALSE
8   Subject_8    129     126       3        FALSE
9   Subject_9    134     126       8        FALSE
10 Subject_10    139     129      10        FALSE
11 Subject_11    127     132      -5        FALSE
12 Subject_12    122     146     -24        FALSE
13 Subject_13    127     120       7        FALSE
14 Subject_14    135     114      21         TRUE
15 Subject_15    133     121      12        FALSE
16 Subject_16    128     120       8        FALSE
17 Subject_17    147     128      19        FALSE
18 Subject_18    138     120      18        FALSE
19 Subject_19    140     133       7        FALSE
20 Subject_20    132     115      17         TRUE


Print the data frame out nicely in final document

knitr::kable(bp_df)

title: Programming in Base R
text:
Create vectors for before and after placebo

placebo_pre_bp <- c(138, 135, 147, 117, 152, 134, 114, 121, 131, 130)
placebo_pre_bp

 [1] 138 135 147 117 152 134 114 121 131 130

placebo_post_bp <- c(105, 136, 123, 130, 134, 143, 135, 139, 120, 124)
placebo_post_bp

 [1] 105 136 123 130 134 143 135 139 120 124


Assign names to the vector elements using paste() function

placebo_patient <- paste("Subject", 1:10, sep = "_")
placebo_patient

 [1] "Subject_1"  "Subject_2"  "Subject_3"  "Subject_4"  "Subject_5" 
 [6] "Subject_6"  "Subject_7"  "Subject_8"  "Subject_9"  "Subject_10"


Create the same names for each vectors elements using the names() function

names(placebo_pre_bp) <- placebo_patient
names(placebo_post_bp) <- placebo_patient

Calculate the change in blood pressure for each patient by subtracting post-placebo measurements from pre-placebo measurements. Create a Vector for this object.

placebo_diff_bp <- c(placebo_pre_bp - placebo_post_bp)
placebo_diff_bp

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
        33         -1         24        -13         18         -9        -21 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
       -18         11          6 


Create a vector corresponding to TRUE if the placebo_post_bp is less than 120 and FALSE if it is not

placebo_bp_under_120 <- placebo_post_bp < 120
placebo_bp_under_120

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
      TRUE      FALSE      FALSE      FALSE      FALSE      FALSE      FALSE 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
     FALSE      FALSE      FALSE 


Create a new data frame with this data in it that is similar to the data frame from task two (including the new column of TRUE/FALSE)

placebo_bp_df <- data.frame(placebo_patient,placebo_pre_bp,placebo_post_bp,placebo_diff_bp,placebo_bp_under_120, row.names = NULL)
placebo_bp_df

   placebo_patient placebo_pre_bp placebo_post_bp placebo_diff_bp
1        Subject_1            138             105              33
2        Subject_2            135             136              -1
3        Subject_3            147             123              24
4        Subject_4            117             130             -13
5        Subject_5            152             134              18
6        Subject_6            134             143              -9
7        Subject_7            114             135             -21
8        Subject_8            121             139             -18
9        Subject_9            131             120              11
10      Subject_10            130             124               6
   placebo_bp_under_120
1                  TRUE
2                 FALSE
3                 FALSE
4                 FALSE
5                 FALSE
6                 FALSE
7                 FALSE
8                 FALSE
9                 FALSE
10                FALSE


Now create and store a list with two elements: • 1st element named treatment and contains the first data frame you created. • 2nd element named placebo and contains the second data frame you created.

list_bp <- list(treatment = bp_df, placebo = placebo_bp_df)
list_bp

$treatment
      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp bp_under_120
1   Subject_1    120     127      -7        FALSE
2   Subject_2    151     145       6        FALSE
3   Subject_3    125     135     -10        FALSE
4   Subject_4    126     122       4        FALSE
5   Subject_5    115     115       0         TRUE
6   Subject_6    132     122      10        FALSE
7   Subject_7    132     123       9        FALSE
8   Subject_8    129     126       3        FALSE
9   Subject_9    134     126       8        FALSE
10 Subject_10    139     129      10        FALSE
11 Subject_11    127     132      -5        FALSE
12 Subject_12    122     146     -24        FALSE
13 Subject_13    127     120       7        FALSE
14 Subject_14    135     114      21         TRUE
15 Subject_15    133     121      12        FALSE
16 Subject_16    128     120       8        FALSE
17 Subject_17    147     128      19        FALSE
18 Subject_18    138     120      18        FALSE
19 Subject_19    140     133       7        FALSE
20 Subject_20    132     115      17         TRUE
